text: Psalm 124
Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Help
A song of ascents. Of David.\f + \fr Ps 124 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
“If \add it had\add* not \add been\add* Yahweh who was on our side,”
do let Israel say,
“If \add it had\add* not \add been\add* Yahweh who was on our side,
when men rose up against us,
then they would have swallowed us alive,
when their anger was kindled against us.
Then the waters would have flooded over us,
\add the\add* torrent would have passed over our soul.
Then over our soul would have passed
the raging waters.”
Blessed \add be\add* Yahweh,
who has not made\f + \fr 124:6 \ft Hebrew “given” \f* us prey for their teeth.
Our soul has escaped like a bird
from \add the\add* snare of fowlers.
The snare \add is\add* broken, and we have escaped.
Our help \add is\add* in the name of Yahweh,
maker of heaven and earth.
